title: serving post json data support custom convert method
body:
### Describe the problem
Hi, when training model with Tensorflow, tf.Example is frequently-used. Generating train data with 'tf.feature_column.make_parse_example_spec(feature_columns)'  method in 'tf.data.Dataset' means we can use tf.feature_column to process features conveniently.
When combined with estimator, 'estimator.export_savedmodel' method can use the same 'make_parse_example_spec' said above as param 'serving_input_receiver_fn'.After using 'tensorflow.log_model 'and start serving, current model can receive json data and convert to pandas dataframe, then feed to saved model, but raise error because model can only receive tf.Example object.

### Source code / logs
Code Example here:
``` python
fea_columns = [fc.categorical_column_with_hash_bucket("tag", FLAGS.tag_emb_size, dtype=tf.string)]
def parse_exmp(serial_exmp):
  click_label = fc.numeric_column("click_label", default_value=0.0, dtype=tf.float32)
  feature_spec = tf.feature_column.make_parse_example_spec(fea_columns)
  feats = tf.parse_single_example(serial_exmp, features=feature_spec)
  feats.pop('click_label')
  return feats, {'ctr':click_label }
dataset = tf.data.TFRecordDataset(filename)
dataset = dataset.map(parse_exmp, num_parallel_calls=8)
dataset = dataset.batch(batch_size)
# After training, export model
feature_spec = tf.feature_column.make_parse_example_spec(fea_columns)
serving_input_receiver_fn = tf.estimator.export.build_parsing_serving_input_receiver_fn(feature_spec)
saved_estimator_path = classifier.export_savedmodel(FLAGS.output_model, serving_input_receiver_fn)
tensorflow.log_model(tf_saved_model_dir= saved_estimator_path.decode("utf-8"),
                         tf_meta_graph_tags= [tf.saved_model.tag_constants.SERVING],
tf_signature_def_key=tf.saved_model.signature_constants.DEFAULT_SERVING_SIGNATURE_DEF_KEY, artifact_path="model")
```
How to deploy this kind of model?
Can json data convert to tf.Example instead of pandas dataframe?
